intro: Mappianthus iodoides, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its silver-gray leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a distinctive silvery-white underside, which gives it its common name. The flowers are clustered in panicles and bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
